titles.title: State Attorneys General Empowerment Act of 2020

To amend the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994, to permit the attorney general of a State to bring a civil action to eliminate a pattern or practice of violating rights, privileges, or immunities secured or protected by the Constitution or laws of the United States, and for other purposes.
State Attorneys General Empowerment Act of 2020

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
State Attorneys General Empowerment Act of 2020
This bill expands civil enforcement against state and local law enforcement agencies that engage in patterns or practices of conduct that violate constitutional or federal statutory rights.
Among other things, the bill
authorizes states to bring pattern-or-practice cases, gives administrative subpoena power to states (and to the Department of Justice) in pattern-or-practice investigations, and authorizes grants to help states conduct pattern-or-practice investigations.
